name: Decode base64 Data into Script
description:
Creates a base64-encoded data file and decodes it into an executable shell script

Upon successful execution, sh will execute art.sh, which is a base64 encoded command, that echoes `Hello from the Atomic Red Team` 
and uname -v

data.command:
if [ "$(uname)" = 'FreeBSD' ]; then cmd="b64decode -r"; else cmd="base64 -d"; fi;
cat /tmp/encoded.dat | $cmd > /tmp/art.sh
chmod +x /tmp/art.sh
/tmp/art.sh

steps.name: Check dependency 1/1
steps.description: encode the command into base64 file

data.command: if [ -e "/tmp/encoded.dat" ]; then exit 0; else exit 1; fi

steps.name: Resolve dependency 1/1
steps.description: encode the command into base64 file

data.command:
if [ "$(uname)" = 'FreeBSD' ]; then cmd="b64encode -r -"; else cmd="base64"; fi;
echo "#{shell_command}" | $cmd > /tmp/encoded.dat

steps.name: Re-check dependency 1/1
steps.description: encode the command into base64 file

data.command: if [ -e "/tmp/encoded.dat" ]; then exit 0; else exit 1; fi

input_arguments.name: shell_command
input_arguments.value: echo Hello from the Atomic Red Team && uname -v
